_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 13:01:11 using v2.2
title: Do outpatients report having their appointment date changed?
analysis_commentary: For outpatients, we do see a change in the proportion of those reporting that their appointment date had been changed, with those reporting any change increasing from 20% in 2004 to 23% in 2011. In the same year, it appears that repeat appointments contribute more heavily to this overall change, with 26% of those attending a repeat appointment reporting a change in date compared to just 14% of those attending a first appointment. Again, we see little connection between experiences reported in the Outpatient Survey and the changes in cancelled operations data observed above.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
